question: From which of the following does the external urethral meatus develop?

A woman presents to the clinic with the complaint of cessation of the menstrual cycle for the last 3 months. Previously she had regular menstruation occurring every 30th day and continued for 4 days. On what day of the cycle this woman is most likely to ovulate?
Which type of epithelial transition is seen between the vagina and cervix?

answers.option: Simple squamous to stratified columnar epithelium
Stratified squamous to simple columnar epithelium
Simple columnar to simple squamous epithelium
Simple squamous to simple columnar epithelium
Stratified squamous to stratified columnar epithelium

question: Which of the following structures surrounds part of the urethra?

answers.option: Imaginary line joining two ischial tuberosities

question: Which of the following glands are located in the deep perineal pouch of males?

Which cells surround and nurture developing oocytes within the ovary?
Which of the following correctly lists the protective coverings of the testes from outermost to innermost?

answers.option: Tunica albuginea, tunica vasculosa, parietal layer of tunica vaginalis, visceral layer of tunica vaginalis
Tunica vasculosa, parietal layer of tunica vaginalis, visceral layer of tunica vaginalis, tunica albuginea
Parietal layer of tunica vaginalis, visceral layer of tunica vaginalis, tunica albuginea, tunica vasculosa
Visceral layer of tunica vaginalis, parietal layer of tunica vaginalis, tunica albuginea, tunica vasculosa
Tunica vasculosa, tunica albuginea, parietal layer of tunica vaginalis, visceral layer of tunica vaginalis

question: Which of the following properties of the prostatic capsule differentiates it from other glandular capsules?

In a laboratory, the hormone levels during different phases of the ovarian cycle of a 20-year-old female are monitored. During which of the following periods is the progesterone level the highest?
What is the role of the enzyme aromatase in the female reproductive system?
What is the primary function of the corpus luteum in the absence of pregnancy?

answers.option: Producing progesterone to maintain the uterine lining

question: What is the World Health Organization's (WHO) recommended age of initiation of weaning among normal-weight infants?

A 7-month pregnant lady visits an antenatal clinic for a regular checkup. Which vaccine must be recommended to this lady for safe delivery?

A 20-year-old unmarried girl presents to the outpatient department with complaints of scanty menstrual flow and excessive facial hair growth. Her menstrual cycles are irregular and she bleeds every 2 to 3 months. Clinically, she is obese with a body mass index (BMI) of 30 kg/m². Thyroid is not palpable. Her lab tests show an altered FSH/LH ratio, normal TSH, and prolactin. Pelvic ultrasound shows peripherally arranged follicles with increased ovarian volume. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 13-year-old female patient is brought by her mother to the gynecology outpatient department with complaints of monthly lower abdominal pain for one year. She has not started menstruating but her secondary characteristics are normal. On examination, a bluish tense bulge is seen at the introitus. Which structural anomaly of the pelvis is suspected in this patient?

A 28-year-old female, married for 5 years, para 3+0, all pre-term deliveries at 32, 30, and 30 weeks, is found to have a developmental anomaly on a hysterosalpingogram. What is the most common developmental anomaly of the uterus responsible for recurrent preterm deliveries in this patient?
Which of the following correctly identifies the reason why prostatic hyperplasia predominantly affects muscle fibers?

answers.option: 5 alpha-reductase is located only in stromal cells
Dihydrotestosterone (DHT) is located only in the stromal cells

question: A 30-year-old male developed epididymitis. On culture, gram-negative diplococci, Neisseria gonorrhea, was located. Which one of the following laboratory culture media will be the most appropriate to grow this particular organism?

Each year, there are an estimated 6 million new cases of syphilis globally in people aged 15-49 years. Which of the following best corresponds to the most common signs and symptoms of early or ''primary syphilis'' infection?

answers.option: High grade fever with body aches
Painful chancre, sores on the face
Painless chancre, sores on the genitals and/or mouth

question: A healthy infant is born to a healthy mother; however, his weight decreases 5 to 10 percent within the first 2 to 3 days of his life. This may be due to which of the following reasons?

answers.option: Loss of fluid from the body
Use of body proteins for energy
Metabolism of brown fat for thermogenesis
Lungs get cleared of amniotic fluid

answers.option: Maturation of stromal cells of ovaries

answers.option: To transport initiating amino acyl tRNA to P site

A 32-year-old male presents to the reproductive endocrinology clinic with a complaint of not having children since he got married. The patient reports a lack of facial and body hair development, reduced muscle mass, and diminished libido. Upon further investigation, his plasma testosterone levels are found to be significantly low with low levels of follicle-stimulating hormone (FSH) and luteinizing hormone (LH). Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

answers.option: Hypogonadotropic hypogonadism due to a genetic mutation
